text:
I have installed LightGraphsFlows. According to Pkg.status, the version is v0.4.1. From the source code, `mincut` is an exported function. Yet I get the following (`mincut` is not listed):
```julia> names(LightGraphsFlows)
10-element Array{Symbol,1}:
 :BoykovKolmogorovAlgorithm
 :DinicAlgorithm
 :EdmondsKarpAlgorithm
 :ExtendedMultirouteFlowAlgorithm
 :KishimotoAlgorithm
 :LightGraphsFlows
 :PushRelabelAlgorithm
 :maximum_flow
 :mincost_flow
 :multiroute_flow```
So I cannot call `min_cut` after `using LightGraphsFlows` . I have to do `LightGraphsFlows.mincut`. Does anyone know why `mincut` is not exported in v0.4.1?

elements.text: I have installed LightGraphsFlows. According to Pkg.status, the version is v0.4.1. From the source code,
is an exported function. Yet I get the following (

text:
You could use `using LightGraphsFlows: mincut`.

I think the reason why it is not exported is, because there is a conflict with `LightGraphs` that also exports a function called `mincut` , so one could not use the exported symbol from both packages at the same time. Although the proper way would probably be to just extend the method in `LightGraphsFlows` , then it could also be exported without problems.
